title: So, you're making a completely new item, Riot?
body:
You aren't changing Zeke's Herald. In fact, the only similarity is Zeke in the name. You making a complete new item here. 
- New icon
- New passive
- Gained Active
- Loses AD buff
- –10% CD reduction
- replaces health bonus with mana bonus
- Gain's armor
- No lifesteal

You guys should just change it to say Harbinger and keep the original Zeke's Herald. The new item is nice, but majority of supports would rather Zeke's Herald. So, why not have both?

Zeke's Herald is problematic in that the stats it gives on its own aren't enough to justify buying it. Supports can't make good use of the AD or the lifesteal and the CDR often goes to waste due to the high amount of CDR support items. Other roles have far better appealing items that they can buy. The item is a waste of a slot on the champions that could make good use of the aura and completely terrible on any champion that isn't AD. It's bad on supports because the stats and build path are terrible. It's bad on damage dealers because it doesn't give that much damage. For a support it'd be like if your Irelia top built Abyssal so that your all magic damage team could do more damage.

The only time Zeke's is worth buying is if you have 3+ physical damage dealers on your team who would heavily benefit from it. Even then, though, it's usually still not worth building over other items. It's a weird situation where the only time the item is really effective is when the other four members of your team are all AD. The problem with this is that your team will all be dealing the same type of damage, so the enemy team will just itemize accordingly and hard counter your team. Making full use of Zeke's usually means you have a terrible teamcomp.

Neither the aura nor the stats have leeway to be buffed. The item is already gold efficient on its own. If you nerf the stats to buff the aura, you only further drive it into its niche. If you nerf the aura to buff the stats, then there really becomes no reason to take it over other items that give the same stats with better utility. If you just buff it, then everybody will start taking it because of its gold efficiency. It could be made better for supports by switching some of the cooldown reduction to more health, but this doesn't change any of its core problems.

The new Zeke's is a far better step in the right direction for multiple reasons.

**First:** It still retains the "damage boost" that the previous aura gave albeit as a charging method instead of a constant aura. It only loses out on the lifesteal.

**Second:** Because it's a charging method instead of a constant aura, it has room for counterplay. You can engage when the charges are low and disengage when the charges are high to avoid the damage boost. It also partially negates the "invisible power" provided by the aura (hopefully there will be a visual indicator for the passive).

**Third:** The item's stats make it a good pickup for multiple roles. Mages, supports, and tanks could make good use of the mixed stats it provides.

**Fourth:** It has a better build path. This goes hand in hand with reason #3.

**Fifth:** The passive is useful on pretty much every role. Tanks and supports could use it to boost the damage of a team member. Every other role would like the extra crit/ap.

In fact, I'd guess that the new item is a little bit too strong. It gives a ridiculous amount of stats for only 2300 gold, and the passive looks monstrous. I guess it'd all depend on how fast the charges accumulate and what the stats for the item are when it actually goes live though.

Though you made great points, I didn't want to get rid of the new item. I never said it was bad or worse except that I'd miss the original passive on the old one. The item, itself, isn't really meant to be multi-useful for every type of champion because there are those few that will not benefit from the new one as well (but pretty much all supports can use it). 

Mages that will support usually prefer large AP items. Or at least the ones I play against just get AP. I also believe that all supports can benefit from Zeke's Herald in one way or another. Bard could use the CD reduction, Braum could use the health and CD reduction, Janna, Lulu, and Nami would benefit from CD reduction, Nunu would benefit from the health and CD reduction, Sona would benefit from the CD reduction, Soraka would benefit from both the health CDR, Tahm Kench and Taric definitely benefits from the health and CDR, and even Thresh and Zilean would benefit from the CDR. (The CDR is all I got in this argument to keep it... but tanks like Braum and Tahm Kench then Taric too benefit from its health).

You can also buff Zeke's Herald. If we raise the gold price of Zeke's Herald to 3300 gold and give it the Bilgewater Cutlass item to buff the damage to 30 to those nearby and allow a active to slow an enemy by 25% for 2 seconds dealing 50 (+50% AP) to the enemy (90 second cool down) and makes the passive inactive until active is back up. It's simple trials that they can put on the PBE that could ask for.

I also wish people wouldn't be so harsh to the item. True, its been just sitting in the shop for a long time now, but it can still be used.

Zeke's Herald is usually taken for its damage boosting passive. The new Zeke's retains a damage boosting passive even if it is somewhat different. The core idea behind the items remains somewhat similar, so it's not as if the item is entirely different.

>Mages that will support usually prefer large AP items. Or at least the ones I play against just get AP.

I was actually referring to mid lane mages using the item, but bot lane mages could too I guess. The item gives a 20% AP boost when the passive is up, which is pretty massive. I couldn't see them getting it during lane phase or in every game, but it could be useful in certain situations.

>The CDR is all I got in this argument to keep it... but tanks like Braum and Tahm Kench then Taric too benefit from its health

One of the biggest problems with buying Zeke's is that most support items already give 10% CDR. If you buy Zeke's and then buy two other items then you'll probably hit the CDR cap. Buying any other CDR item means that the stats go to waste, which is part of the problem with Zeke's. Zeke's is actually a bad item for tanks because there are other items that give much better tank stats. Most tank items have at least 400 health and come with resists. Locket only costs 350 more gold while giving 150 more HP, 20 more MR (also 20 MR from aura for a total of 40), and an active at the cost of 10% CDR. Zeke's is just pathetic as a tank item in comparison.

>You can also buff Zeke's Herald. If we raise the gold price of Zeke's Herald to 3300 gold and give it the Bilgewater Cutlass item to buff the damage to 30 to those nearby and allow a active to slow an enemy by 25% for 2 seconds dealing 50 (+50% AP) to the enemy (90 second cool down) and makes the passive inactive until active is back up. It's simple trials that they can put on the PBE that could ask for.

I don't think that would solve any of the problems the item has though. It still doesn't give enough damage to warrant an AD buying it and the stats would still be pathetic for anyone else. It'd also be even more of a gold sink for anyone who can't use it very well on their own, with a build path that's still terrible for supports and tanks (why would they build a vamp scepter?) There's also the possibility that the item is actually so good that it becomes a mandatory buy because of the aura, similar to how Bulwark was.

I actually talked with my friend on this, who gets up to Gold easily and then just stops so he can get the free skin, and he even said he'd recommend the original Zeke's Herald. You keep putting it down since it only gives 20 bonus damage, but you keep forgetting that it is permanent. The total damage would raise to 200 damage able to give rather than just 20% of my AP over the next 6 seconds. It also does not give any bonus damage, it just gives +50% critical damage for the next 6 seconds. My AP and my allies are raised by 20% for 6 seconds. 

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-e_UFDSUSJ9A/VaQh6E3O6cI/AAAAAAAAti0/95v_UQS9SkQ/s1600/zee.jpg

This goes well with my point on the matter, **WHO CARES IF THIS ONE IS BETTER TO MOST?**(who for some reason just want ZH to be gone) why can we not keep Zeke's Herald anyway for those who use it? I prefer giving bonus AD over bonus critical chance. This would had been nicer if it (instead) gave +50 AD for 6 seconds, but critical chance...

You also asked why I'd put that item on there? Well, then again, ask why Riot made a item where you first get AD and lifesteal before the item itself. The item in discussion is in fact **not pathetic** since it gives free lifesteal and bonus AD already. A BF Sword only gives 50 AD, a BloodThirster only gives 80 AD (and they cost 1550 and 3500 respectively while ZH costs 2450).

>The total damage would raise to 200 damage able to give rather than just 20% of my AP over the next 6 seconds.

Well let's say one person did 200 damage with the original Zeke's and one person gained 20% AP with the new Zeke's. At 500 AP, that's a bonus 100 AP (might be more with Deathcap). Even if the mage only had a .5 AP ratio on all their skills, that's still equivalent to the 200 damage provided by old Zeke's for auto attacks. Comparatively, however, the time to get that damage is much lower because it's on spells instead of 10 auto attacks. Hence, the item is now much better on mages than before. There's no way they're going to be able to throw out all those auto attacks without someone jumping on them.

>I prefer giving bonus AD over bonus critical chance.

Critical chance is actually VERY VERY strong. 

For an example, let's assume we have a level 10 Caitlyn with Infinity Edge and Statikk Shiv. At level 10, Cait has 73 attack damage. Let's also assume she has 11 flat AD from runes (1 quint 9 marks).  With Zeke's aura, runes, and IE, this brings Cait to 184 AD. Her auto attack multiplier for auto attacks is 2.5 because of IE. Her attack speed is ~1.07. Theoretically:

40 of 100 attacks will be crits
60 of 100 attacks will be normal attacks.

40 x 184 x 2.5 = 18400 physical damage.
60 x 184 = 11040 physical damage.
11040 + 18400 = 29440 physical damage in 100 attacks. 
With an attack speed of 1.07, this takes ~93 seconds.
29440 physical damage / 93 seconds = **~317 average physical DPS with Zeke's.**

With no Zeke's:

40 x 164 x 2.5 = 16400 physical damage.
60 x 164 = 9840 physical damage.
9840 + 16400 = 26240 physical damage in 100 attacks.
26240 physical damage / 93 seconds = **~282 average physical DPS without Zeke's**

With new Zeke's (we're calculating the average dps with zeke's passive up):

+50% crit chance so...
90 of 100 attacks will be crits
10 of 100 attacks will be normal attacks

90 x 164 x 2.5 = 36900 physical damage
10 x 164 = 1640 physical damage
36900 + 1640 = 38540 physical damage in 100 attacks.
38540 physical damage / 93 seconds = **~414 average physical DPS with new Zeke's**

So let's compare these in a fight.

414 physical DPS (new Zeke's) - 317 physical DPS (current Zeke's) = 97 more physical DPS
97 physical DPS x 6 seconds (new Zeke's passive uptime) = 582 more physical damage before reverting to no Zeke's.

317 physical DPS (current Zeke's) - 282 physical DPS (no Zeke's) = 35 more physical DPS.
582 physical damage / 35 physical DPS = ~17 seconds.

**It would take ~17 seconds for current Zeke's to catch up after new Zeke's passive ends.**

With how large of a gap in DPS there is, however, it's highly likely new Zeke's passive would come up again before current Zeke's manages to catch up in damage.

Considering how current Zeke's only gave 35 more physical DPS than without Zeke's for a champion with two crit items, it's highly unlikely that the aura would make a huge impact on the DPS of champions without crit chance (i.e. you need a bunch of physical damage dealers, preferably with crit, to even out the damage difference which just forces you into a bad teamcomp).

As the game goes on, the extra AD becomes worse and worse in comparison because endgame ADCs will have around 300 AD. An extra 20 won't make that big of a difference but the 50% crit chance will.

Although it's up 100% of the time and it has an aura, the only real advantage current Zeke's has over new Zeke's is the lifesteal. There's also numerous benefits for new Zeke's that I described earlier.

>WHO CARES IF THIS ONE IS BETTER TO MOST?

The new Zeke's is objectively better than the current Zeke's in almost every way.

>I'm done with your lame arguments and the fact you can't see that Zeke's Herald was OP in its own way.

Zeke's isn't even close to OP. It's so bad that it never sees use. A quick glance at its stats on lolking suggests that it appears in around .16% of games. That's **16 in 10000** games. If it was OP in any way, more people would be using it.

Furthermore your entire response was basically you just claiming that the new Zeke's is OP as if that somehow discredits any of what I said. The only thing it being OP would affect in my arguments is the DPS calculation.

 For the sake of argument, let's assume the critical chance is nerfed to 25% and reuse those Caitlyn examples. For these examples I will refer to this theoretical Zeke's as "nerfed Zeke's"

I calculated previously that the **average physical DPS with current Zeke's would be 317.**

With nerfed Zeke's:

65 x 164 x 2.5 = 26650 physical damage
35 x 164 = 5740 physical damage
26650 + 5740 = 32290 physical damage in 100 attacks.
32290 physical damage / 93 seconds = **~347 average physical DPS with nerfed Zeke's**

347 physical DPS - 317 physical DPS = 30 more physical DPS
30 x 6 = 180 physical damage.

I calculated previously that the **average physical DPS without Zeke's would be 282.**

317 physical DPS - 282 physical DPS = 35 more physical DPS.
180/35 = ~5 seconds for current Zeke's to overtake nerfed Zeke's.

Someone else mentioned that new Zeke's charges about twice as fast as Statikk Shiv. Assuming they aren't wrong, the damage on this nerfed Zeke's would be about equivalent to the damage provided by current Zeke's for one person at least based on how quickly the passive would be back up. The aura would throw the numbers in favor of current Zeke's. 

However, new Zeke's would still have an edge in better build path and stats which, along with its very small niche, are the key problems that prevent current Zeke's from being good. Also keep in mind that this is all neglecting any bonuses the support is getting from the item as some people build AP on their supports and would get 20% bonus AP (which would probably get nerfed to 10% or something).

**If we factored in lategame the numbers would tilt back towards nerfed Zeke's** as I will demonstrate using Caitlyn again.

For an example, let's assume we have a level 17 Caitlyn with Infinity Edge, Berserker's Greaves, Statikk Shiv, Bloodthirster, and Last Whisper. At level 17, Cait has 97 attack damage. Let's also assume she has 11 flat AD from runes (1 quint 9 marks). With Zeke's aura, runes, IE, BT, and LW, this brings Cait to 328 AD. Her auto attack multiplier for auto attacks is 2.5 because of IE. With Berserker's and Statikk, she reaches an attack speed of ~1.42.

40 x 328 x 2.5 = 32800 physical damage.
60 x 328 = 19680 physical damage.
32800 + 19680 = 52480 physical damage in 100 attacks.
With an attack speed of 1.42, this takes ~70 seconds.
52480 physical damage / 70 seconds = **~750 average physical DPS with Zeke's.**

With no Zeke's:

40 x 308 x 2.5 = 30800 physical damage.
60 x 308 = 18480 physical damage.
30800 + 18480 = 49280 physical damage in 100 attacks.
49280 physical damage / 70 seconds = **~704 average physical DPS without Zeke's**

With nerfed Zeke's:

65 x 308 x 2.5 = 50050 physical damage
35 x 308 = 10780 physical damage
50050 + 10780 = 60830 physical damage in 100 attacks.
60830 physical damage / 70 seconds = **869 average physical DPS with nerfed Zeke's**

869 physical DPS - 750 physical DPS = 119 more physical DPS
119 physical DPS x 6 seconds = 714 more physical damage

750 physical DPS - 704 = 46 more physical DPS
714 physical damage / 46 physical DPS = **~16 seconds for current Zeke's to catch up after nerfed Zeke's passive ends.**

As I stated before, the passive would just come up again and current Zeke's wouldn't be able to catch up.

We could probably nerf this again to 20 or even 15%, but the results would probably be the same except current Zeke's would be better early game.

The current design for Zeke's Herald is not worth keeping. It really isn't.

All the (archetype) supports don't use AD efficiently, and by extension, don't use Lifesteal efficiently either. They can use the health and CDR, but pretty much *every* good support item has CDR, and the health on it is basically what they get out of Sightstone.

The only (role) supports that use Zeke's well are actually bruisers.

On top of that, Zeke's is a remnant from an older time, when stacking auras for a bunch of team fight power was normal. It was common to see people *double-stack* auras, because the item itself has great stats, and then you'd get double the effect of the aura due to how they stack.
